thread.title: Manchester United Fans Are Convinced Fan Favourite's Career At The Club Is Over
thread.title_full: Manchester United Fans Are Convinced Fan Favourite's Career At The Club Is Over

title: Manchester United Fans Are Convinced Fan Favourite's Career At The Club Is Over

organizations.name: manchester united fans are convinced fan favourite

text:
Manchester United Fans Are Convinced Fan Favourite's Career At The Club Is Over Sun Feb 05 2017 19:46:30   19:46:30 GMT+0000 (GMT) Jack Kenmare Jack Kenmare in football 
Luke Shaw has been left out of the Manchester United squad for today's match against Leicester City , prompting a lot of supporters to speculate that his career at Old Trafford might well be over. 
The England international couldn't even make the bench for today's Premier League clash at the King Power Stadium, and his absence from United squads has been something of a recurring theme this season. 
Of course, Shaw was out injured for almost a year after suffering a double leg-break during his Champions League debut back in September 2015. 
And it appears he is struggling to reach the impressive levels of performances which enticed United to pay Southampton Â£30 million for his services back in 2014. 
Whatever the reasons behind his continued omission, some supporters reckon seeing Shaw in the iconic red jersey might be a thing of the past: Jose Mourinho has overlooked Luke Shaw once again. The #MUFC left-back was not in the squad against Hull & has not travelled to Leicester - Simon Peach (@SimonPeach) February 5, 2017 Anthony Martial on the bench once again, and what can I say about Luke Shaw. It's a real shame but it looks like his United future is over..
